boat.name: Alando
boat.full_description:
Alando is a 27 ft smack, one of four built by Aldous in 1923 for the oyster trade. Originally registered as CK1, then LO111, and removed from the register in 1938, her history is unknown until the 1970s. If you have any details please get in touch. She first took part in the OGA East Coast Race in 1973, when owned by A R Dunnet of Chelmondiston.

Restored by Joe Dunnett in the 1970s, with new Terylene sails by James Lawrence of Brightlingsea, Alando spent time in Falmouth and Scotland before returning to Maldon in 2003 when she was purchased by her present owner and kept on the Medway at Gillingham.
boat.short_description: Alando was built by Aldous in 1923, originally registerd as CK1. She was removed from the register in 1938 and her history until the 1970s remains a mystery.

for_sales.sales_text:
26" Essex smack Alando CK178. Built by Aldous, Brightlingsea 1923.

Three berths, inboard diesel engine. Owned since 2003 and much work carried out by owner. Recently refitted. Looks great, sails beautifully.
Currently located Gillingham River Medway.
for_sales.summary: 26" Essex smack Alando CK178. Built by Aldous, Brightlingsea 1923. Looks great, sails beautifully.
